title: Beyond the Genetics of Addiction
descriptions:
The proposed project, "Beyond the Genetics of Addiction," aims to delve deeper into the genetic and environmental factors contributing to addiction by studying substances such as nicotine, alcohol, cannabis, and caffeine. Using extended twin family designs, DNA-variant data, RNA data, and biomarkers analysis, the project will leverage the Netherlands Twin Register as a sample source to achieve its objectives.

These objectives include unraveling the genetic and environmental factors' contributions to addiction, identifying and confirming genes and gene networks associated with addiction, exploring gene expression patterns, investigating biomarkers related to addiction, and studying the relationship between substance use and health. The project will utilize a longitudinal phenotype database and biological samples for data sources.

The researchers involved in this project have extensive experience in data collection, coordination of data collection, data analysis, behavior genetics, and addiction research since 1999. The project also involves additional data collection efforts, a large sample size, and the use of state-of-the-art analysis methods.

This grant proposal seeks funding to support the critical research needed to advance our understanding of addiction beyond genetics, ultimately leading to more effective prevention and treatment strategies for individuals struggling with substance use disorders.
